com.ibm.gaiandb.tools.replay

Class BrokerConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.gaiandb.tools.replay.BrokerConnector

  • public class BrokerConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    hbowyer / DavidVyvyan A BrokerConnector connects to a broker and subscribes to given topics. It also allows messages to be published to the broker. To process incoming messages differently (other than printing them out), override method publishArrived(). To publish messages, use method publishMessage().

    • Constructor Detail

      • BrokerConnector

        public BrokerConnector(java.lang.String mqttClientName,
                       java.lang.String brokerAddress,
                       int brokerPortNumber,
                       java.lang.String topic)
                throws MqttException,
                       MqttNotConnectedException
        Constructor for the WMQTTSubscriber. Creates a WMQTT client object with the broker details. NOTE: Registers the object as a simple WMQTT callback handler to receive the connectionLost() and publishArrived() calls.
        Throws:
        MqttException
        MqttNotConnectedException

      • connectionLost

        public void connectionLost()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is implemented as part of the MQIsdpSimpleCallback interface. It is automatically called when the WMQTT client looses it connection to the broker. Simply call the connect method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Disconnect the WMQTT client from the broker.

      • publishArrived

        public void publishArrived(java.lang.String topic,
                           byte[] messageData,
                           int qos,
                           boolean retain)
        publishArrived() is implemented as part of the MQIsdpSimpleCallback interface. It is a callback method used by subscribers to automatically receive publications that are forwarded to them by a broker. Here it is used to forward messages on to other brokers that we have set up links to using method setForwardingLinkToBroker()
